page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area studied was totally rural. The main parish within the boundaries was Rushock. This cannot be called a village, because the settlement is dispersed. The farms are relatively small and mixed. Although several have changed hands in recent years, there has been no sale to large scale organisations. The farms are still family businesses. There is one church built in the 18th century, at Rushock. It formed part of the Chaddesley Corbett Estate. The children attend first school in Cutnall Green, and then transfer to Droitwich for middle and high schooling. There is one shop/ post office within the parish. Most inhabitants do their main shopping in Droitwich or Kidderminster. There are "newcomers" in the area. They commute to towns in the area, and to Birmingham. Public transport is poor.
